key_title: Key to the species of Calystegia

Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Convolvulaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Bindweeds (Convolvulus L.: Convolvulaceae) in Victoria
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (2012). Bindweeds (Convolvulus L.: Convolvulaceae) in Victoria. In: Victorian Naturalist 129, pp. 10-19. Field Naturalist Club of Victoria, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves membranous, ovate to lanceolate, acute; bracteoles longer than calyx; plants twining
Leaves fleshy, reniform, apex rounded to emarginate; bracteoles slightly shorter than calyx; plants trailing, rarely twining; coastal dunes of far East Gippsland and Wilsons Promontory
Corolla more than 2.5 cm long; bracteoles more or less ovate, 1 cm long or more; peduncles longer than petioles
Corolla less than 2.5 cm long; bracteoles more or less orbicular, usually less than 1 cm long; peduncles not longer than petioles
Bracteoles 1.5–2 cm long, less than 15 mm wide, acute; calyx to 1.5 cm long; capsule subglobose, 7–8 mm long
Bracteoles 2–3.5 cm long, more than 15 mm wide, blunt, rounded to truncate, emarginate; calyx 1.5–2 cm long; capsule ovoid, 10–12 mm long
